questions.question: Which among the following is pressure epiphysis
questions.explanation: pressure epiphysis as it forms the shoulder joint and bears load during movements. Types of Epiphysis: Pressure Epiphysis – Participates in joint formation and weight transmission (e.g., head of humerus, lower end of radius). Traction Epiphysis – Non-articular, does not transmit weight (e.g., greater/lesser trochanter of femur, greater/lesser tubercle of humerus, mastoid process). Atavistic Epiphysis – Once independent but fused for nutrition (e.g., coracoid process of scapula, os trigonum). Aberrant Epiphysis – Not always present (e.g., head of the first metacarpal, base of other metacarpals). The other options (elbow joint, wrist joint, and sternum) are not classified as pressure epiphyses. Reference: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC2564388/

questions.question: Which of the following is the most common site of an osteoporotic fracture?
questions.explanation: known as wedge compression fractures, typically resulting from a flexion force. These fractures usually maintain stability as the posterior elements remain intact. Incorrect Options: Options B, C & D: Fractures in osteoporosis typically result from low-trauma incidents, such as falls from standing height or less. However, fractures in locations like the subtrochanteric region, glenoid, and midshaft of the humerus often require higher forces. The initial fracture in osteoporosis often involves the distal radius (Colles’ fracture), followed by vertebral and hip fractures if not treated promptly. Reference: .

questions.question: A 23 year old male reports severe pain, swelling, and an inability to extend his knee after a fall. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation: fracture of the patella. Radiographs revealed a comminuted patellar fracture. There is moderate knee joint effusion. Incorrect Options: Option B - Rheumatoid arthritis: The given X-ray does not exhibit symmetrical joint space narrowing, a classical radiological feature of rheumatoid arthritis. Option C - Hemarthrosis: The X-ray does not display widening of the intercondylar notch, a radiological feature commonly associated with hemarthrosis. Option D - Tibial condylar fracture: The provided X-ray does not reveal any fracture of the tibial condyle. Reference: .

questions.question: Identify the zone of calcification in the image given below.
questions.explanation: representing the zone of calcification, also referred to as the zone of provisional ossification. Incorrect Options: Options B - B: Zone B in the diagram indicates the zone of hypertrophy. Option C - C: Zone C in the illustration represents the zone of proliferation. Option D - D Zone D in the diagram corresponds to the reserve zone.

questions.question: A 22-year-old male presents with thigh pain. A CT scan was done as given below. Identify the condition.?
questions.explanation: its primary role being the detection of sequestrum, a characteristic feature best visualized using this imaging technique. CT and MRI scans collectively demonstrate the extent of bone destruction, reactive edema, concealed abscesses, and sequestra within the affected area. Incorrect Options: Option A :Osteomalacia: Looser's zones or milkman fracture or pseudofracture is seen on the radiograph. Option B:Osteosarcoma: Sunburst or sunray pattern of periosteal reaction is seen on x-ray. Option C: Ewings sarcoma: Shows Bone outgrowth continuous with the cortex/ Mushroom appearance Reference: .

questions.question: Identify the structure marked in the given image.
questions.explanation: structure marked is posterior ribs which can be identified as transverse white lines. Incorrect Options: Options A, C & D are incorrect Reference: .

questions.question: At what age in women DEXA scan is done routinely ?
questions.explanation: is typically recommended for women at the age of 65 years. This age is chosen because it is considered the threshold age for increased risk of osteoporosis and fractures in women. Incorrect Options: Option A, B,C - routine DEXA scan is not typically recommended at this age unless there are specific risk factors present. Reference: Prepladder Notes

questions.question: Following a fall in the bathroom , an elderly lady is diagnosed with fractured neck of the femur . Which of the following coexisting conditions most likely predisposed to this?
questions.explanation: density and increased bone fragility, making individuals more susceptible to fractures, especially in the hip, spine, and wrist. In the case of an elderly lady who experienced a fall and was diagnosed with a fractured neck of the femur (hip fracture), osteoporosis is a likely contributing factor. Incorrect Options: Option B - Osteopetrosis: Osteopetrosis is a rare genetic disorder characterized by increased bone density and abnormal bone growth. While it can lead to brittle bones and increased risk of fractures, it is a rare condition and not commonly the underlying cause of fractures in elderly individuals following falls. Option C - Osteoarthritis: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease characterized by the breakdown of cartilage in the joints, it does not directly affect bone density or increase the risk of fractures. Option D - Osteomalacia: Osteomalacia is a condition characterized by softening of the bones due to vitamin D deficiency or problems with vitamin D metabolism. Osteomalacia is more commonly associated with generalized bone pain, muscle weakness, and fractures in weight-bearing bones. Reference: Prepladder Notes
